ref: 6055 trivr̥tā f. ʻ Ipomoea turpethum ʼ Suśr. [MIA. *tivuḍā- (→ Khot. trolä H. W. Bailey BSOS viii 139) sanskritized as tripuṭā -- f. ʻ Convolvulus turpethum ʼ: see EWA i 535. -- trivŕ̊t -- ?]
Pa. tivutā -- f. ʻ Convolvulus turpethum ʼ (learned reconstruction as tiputā -- );
P. tirvī f. ʻ Ipomoea turpethum (used as a purgative) ʼ;
N. tiure ʻ a partic. plant (used for staining nails) ʼ;
Or. tiuṛi ʻ the creepers I. turpethum and Operculina turpethum (root used as a laxative) ʼ;
H. tewṛī f. ʻ Convolvulus or Ipomoea turpethum ʼ;
M. teḍ n. ʻ C. turpethum ʼ, tevḍī f. ʻ I. turpethum ʼ.
